greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the sum of the odd degrees of the irreducible representations of the symmetric group S_n.
comment: a(n) is divisible by 4 for n >= 4. - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Apr 28 2013
reference: John McKay, Irreducible representations of odd degree, Journal of Algebra 20, 1972 pages 416-418.
link: Eric M. Schmidt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Eric M. Schmidt, Sage code to compute this sequence
program: # Simple but inefficient; see links for faster code
